results.title: On the side of the angels
results.creator_credit: Claire Jager, Peter Kaufmann and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: This film presents the story of the people involved in the movement for peace in Australia from 1900 to the present. Using rare archival film, the program reflects on the international events that concerned and influenced many people to organise together for peace and world stability. Features Ralph Gibson, founding member against war and fascism in the 30s, Stephen Murray-Smith, peace historian, Sam Goldbloom, Council for International Cooperation and Disarmament, Jim Cairns, Deputy Prime Minister with the Whitlam government, Jean McLean, radical Victorian Labour MP and Jo Camilleri, Convenor of People for Nuclear Disarmament.

results.title: Witch hunt
results.brief_description: Presented by George Donikan, this documentary is a “Four Corners” style investigation into the so-called Greek Social Security Conspiracy Fraud. The whole story of the scandal and the role of the Federal Police and the Department of Social Security is explored in this documentary.

results.title: A Song of air
results.brief_description: An autobiographical account of a daughter’s relationship with her father from the interior of a “typical” Australian family of the 1950’s. Using original 16mm home movie footage filmed by her father, she speaks by means of voice-over of his severe religious and patriarchal oppression, and her resistance to his values and expectations.

results.title: Life in the Desert
results.brief_description: The viewer is taken into the Australian desert and shown the amazing variety of plants and animals and informed how they manage to survive in such extreme conditions.

results.title: How the west was lost: the story of the 1946 Aboriginal pastoral workers' strike
results.creator_credit: David Noakes, Heather Williams, Market Street Films and Friends Film Productions
results.brief_description: The story of the 1946 Aboriginal Pastoral Workers’ Strike. Eight hundred aboriginal station workers walked off sheep stations in the north west of Western Australia, marking the beginning of a strike which lasted more than three years. The strike was more than a demand for better wages and conditions, it was a struggle for basic human rights.
results.title_for_label: How the west was lost: the story of the 1946 Aboriginal pastoral workers’ strike

results.title: The Science of winning
results.brief_description: This film shows specialists at the Australian Institute of Sport in Canberra working elite athletes, applying the processes of physiology, biochemistry, biomechanics and psychology. This is a thought-provoking document about the development of our systematic scientific approach to sports training.

results.title: Breaking silence
results.brief_description: An epidemic number of children endure their early years in confusion and shame as victims of incest and other forms of sexual exploitation. This documentary goes behind the veneer of domestic bliss to study the incidence and effect of incest on families.

results.title: Private practices: the story of a sex surrogate
results.creator_credit: Kirby Dick and Kirby Dick Productions
results.brief_description: This film is about Maureen Sullivan, a woman who practises a radical new kind of sex therapy. She is a sex surrogate. Her clients are men unable to have successful sexual relationships. Her job is to help them learn how to love. What follows is the story of two clients who allowed their entire therapy to be filmed. Maureen saw each man once a week for four months. Supervised by a therapist, she guided the men through a series of sexual exercises that became progressively more intimate. Narrated by Noreen Hennessey.
results.title_for_label: Private practices: the story of a sex surrogate

results.title: Pitjiri: the snake that will not sink
results.creator_credit: Karen Hughes and Trikon Film Corporation
results.brief_description: In 1936 on a remote outpost in the Northern Territory, nine aboriginal elders appeared before Ruth Heathcock, a young white nurse who they believed was a member of their tribe before the Dreaming. What she later experienced in her healing work is the subject of this extraordinary documentary. A multi-award winning production.
